answers.answer: HI,Your symptoms can be due to PCOS, hormonal imbalance, stress and anxiety, anaemia, cardiac problems, diabetes etc. It can also be due to chronic fatigue syndrome. Consult your Doctor for a thorough evaluation. Hope this helps.Take care & good luck.

Hi!I just googled "debilitating fatigue and pcos" and your post came up. Have you found any relief since posting?I am severely fatigued... like, some days I can hardly get out of bed. If I didn't have to pee all the time, maybe I wouldn't get out of bed at all. But that's another charming symptom of PCOS-related issues.I'm going the Ayurvedic route. I had memory problems (caused by PCOS), which an Ayurvedic practitioner cured earlier this year. I believe if I keep up with Ayurvedic treatments, I can cure my PCOS completely.By the way, I ALSO had extremely high DHEA. 1500 the first time they checked... 1700 the next.
i am the same , but also having body painsgoing back again to see my doctorfeeling like ive been left to suffer

question: Debilitating Fatigue -  As in, it's hard to do anything cardiovascular.High DHEA level 1500 (range of 100-1000)- Could PCOS be the reason why?I am terrified I will never get my energy back.  I am debilitated.  As in, I go to the grocery store and I feel like I need a wheelchair.Thanks.
title: Anyone here have debilitating fatigue?
